summary: A guide to running a LangGraph application locally, covering installation, setup, launching a server, and testing.

structure.title: Run a local server
structure.summary: A guide to running a LangGraph application locally, covering installation, setup, launching a server, and testing.

nodes.path: local-server > Run a local server > Prerequisites
nodes.title: Prerequisites
nodes.summary: Requirements for running a local server, including a LangSmith API key.

nodes.path: local-server > Run a local server > 1. Install the LangGraph CLI
nodes.title: 1. Install the LangGraph CLI
nodes.summary: Instructions for installing the LangGraph CLI using pip or uv, requiring Python 3.11 or higher.

nodes.path: local-server > Run a local server > 2. Create a LangGraph app
nodes.title: 2. Create a LangGraph app
nodes.summary: Create a new LangGraph application using the Python project template via the `langgraph new` command.

nodes.path: local-server > Run a local server > 3. Install dependencies
nodes.title: 3. Install dependencies
nodes.summary: Instructions for installing dependencies in edit mode for a LangGraph app using pip or uv.

nodes.path: local-server > Run a local server > 4. Create a `.env` file
nodes.title: 4. Create a `.env` file
nodes.summary: Instructions for creating a .env file by copying from .env.example and setting the LANGSMITH_API_KEY.

nodes.path: local-server > Run a local server > 5. Launch Agent server
nodes.title: 5. Launch Agent server
nodes.summary: Start the LangGraph API server locally using 'langgraph dev' for development and testing, with in-memory mode.

nodes.path: local-server > Run a local server > 6. Test your application in Studio
nodes.title: 6. Test your application in Studio
nodes.summary: Instructions for connecting to LangGraph Studio UI to test and debug applications locally, including URL setup and Safari compatibility.

nodes.path: local-server > Run a local server > 7. Test the API
nodes.title: 7. Test the API
nodes.summary: Instructions for testing a local LangGraph API using Python SDK (async/sync) and REST API with example code.

nodes.path: local-server > Run a local server > Next steps
nodes.title: Next steps
nodes.summary: Guidance on next steps after running a LangGraph app locally, including deployment via LangSmith and exploring advanced features.
